oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Carolina Country Style: Hosted by Doug Mayes: Tape 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is of a vairety of interviews performed by Doug Mayes (host/personaility) for WBT's Carolina Country Style radio program. The tape features interviews of Del Reeves (entertainer), Bill West (entertainer), Buck Owens (entertainer), George Jones (entertainer), Jimmy C. Newman (entertainer), Ray Pillow (entertainer), Porter Wagoner (entertainer), Wilma Burgess (entertainer), Jeannie Seely (entertainer), and Sonny James (entertainer). Recordings are from a variety of unknown dates. The tape is the first of six tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Doug Mayes; Del Reeves; Bill West; Buck Owens; George Jones; Jimmy C. Newman; Ray Pillow; Porter Wagoner; Wilma Burgess; Jeannie Seely; Sonny James
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Doug Mayes tests the microphone and introduces Del Reeves -- (00:20) Reeves reveals he is from North Carolina, and Reeves reflects on the number of inspirations he has had -- (04:25) Mayes praises Reeves, and both discuss the amount of effort that was needed to get to where Reeves was -- (07:56) Mayes introduces Bill West and inquires about the family aspect of West's work -- (12:03) Mayes introduces Buck Owens, and both discuss the importance of appreciating ones band -- (15:05) Mayes asks Owens to reflect on his international success -- (18:05) Mayes introduces George Jones and both reflect on Jones' presentation -- (26:47) Mayes introduces Jimmy C. Newman, and both reflect on the influence of a successful record and Newman's faith -- (34:43) Mayes introduces Ray Pillow; additionally, both discuss Pillow's diet and his recording trajectory -- (41:33) Mayes introduces Porter Wagoner, and both reflect on country music's and Wagoner's growing popularity -- (47:39) Mayes introduces Wilma Burgess; additionally, both discuss Burgess' sudden success and Burgess' childhood success -- (52:25) Mayes introduces Jeannie Seely, and both discuss where Seely worked before the Porter Wagoner Show -- (56:49) Mayes congratulates Sonny James on his success, and James reflects on the time before he had a hit
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mayes, Doug; Reeves, Del; West, Bill; Owens, Buck, 1929-2006; Jones, George; Jones, George, 1931-2013; Newman, Jimmy C.; Pillow, Ray; Wagoner, Porter; Burgess, Wilma; Seely, Jeannie; James, Sonny;
